sub_title: Senior Director HSSE BeNeLux, France, Southern Europe and Nordics bij JLL

profile_positions.title: Sr. Director HSSE BeNeLux, France, Southern Europe and Nordics
EMEA Regional Environment, Health and Safety Manager

profile_positions.description:
-	Responsible for developing and executing the strategic H&S improvement direction for the European region (Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, Austria, UK, Rumania, Ukraine, Kazakhstan, Israel, Slovenia, Latvia, Estonia, Bulgaria, Ireland, Czech Republic, Malta, Cyprus, Greece, Denmark, Finland, Hungary, Slovakia and Turkey).
-	Advise, guide and coach management on all matters relating to health & safety, including major risk areas of road safety and third party violence.
-	Develop and share best practices templates, policies, practices and procedures, as appropriate for the local market, with the aim of saving local team time and building health and safety management capability.
-	Ensure that all business activities comply with health & safety standards and local regulations, including reporting of incidents.
-	Lead the deployment of the European Health & Safety Assessment process.  This includes leading the execution of the annual assessment as well as assisting the regions in the implementation of the action items identified for improvement throughout the year.
-	Investigate major incidents and common themes to ensure strategies are in place locally and across the region to prevent recurrence or drive down incident rates.
-	Coordinating and collaborating with stakeholders internally, including risk management, HR, operations
profile_positions.title: Regional Head of Health & Safety- Europe

profile_positions.description:
-	Responsible for developing and executing the strategic EHS improvement direction for the region (Netherlands, Belgium, Luxembourg, France, Germany, Italy, Austria, UK, Poland, Russia, Rumania, Ukraine).
-	Lead the deployment of the Corporate Framework Assessment process.  This includes leading the execution of the annual framework assessment as well as assisting the regions in the implementation of the action items identified for improvement throughout the year.
-	Lead the deployment of the Corporate Fatality Prevention Program.
-	Responsible for implementation of several environmental Kaizens. 
-	Help, advice and assist Operational Leaders in the implementation of important EHS processes.
-	Responsible for the creation and implementation of the new Harsco Infrastructure EHS Management System.
-	Member of Harsco’s Sr. EH&S leadership and global steering team 
-	Conduct training in EH&S management and processes.
-	Conduct training in the Corporate Framework Assessment process.
-	Give direction to 4 direct/20 indirect reports.
-	Lead EHS best practice sharing and standardization throughout the region.   Also responsible to ensure alignment to the Harsco overall safety improvement strategy
profile_positions.title: Director Safety, Health & Environment Harsco Infrastructure Europe

profile_positions.description:
-	Responsible for developing and executing the strategic safety and health improvement direction for the region (Manufacturing/Distribution Locations in The Netherlands, Belgium, France, Poland, Germany, UK).
-	Assist in the development, leadership and execution of each locations Safety and Health improvement strategies through the deployment of a proactive improvement process.  The execution includes communication of expectations, assessing progress, performing some of the implementation, and being a resource for all locations.  Embedded in this execution scope is the responsibility of ensuring compliance with all Governmental Safety and Health laws and regulations at all locations.
-	Lead the deployment of the Corporate Safety Excellence and Leadership (SEAL) process.  This includes leading the execution of the annual SEAL assessment as well as assisting each location in the deployment of the action items identified for improvement throughout the year
-	Provide leadership and assistance to all locations in the region for work related injury/illness claim management activities.  Help locations set standard processes, expectations, monitor location management progress, and provide location guidance on proper execution
-	Lead safety best practice sharing and standardization throughout the region.   Also responsible to ensure alignment to the Newell Rubbermaid overall safety improvement strategy
-	Be the Corporate champion in at least 1 Safety and Health subject area per year
-	Participate, give safety updates, and assistance in other operational activities such as GBU ops reviews, lean manufacturing, productivity, new product development, new process or equipment reviews, etc
profile_positions.title: Sr. Manager Safety & Health-EMEA Region

profile_positions.description:
-      Responsible for ensuring the Environment Health & Safety assessment  
       is conducted in an efficient, profession and within the guidelines 
       manner.
-      Responsible for ensuring all manufacturing locations in Europe 
       (Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, France, Poland, UK) have at least one  
       assessment per year.
profile_positions.title: Environment, Health and Safety Lead Auditor Europe
HR Manager Netherlands
